meanings.definition: A person or thing that dumps.
meanings.sent1: The dumper emptied the trash into the bin.
meanings.sent2: The construction site had a big dumper for moving soil.
meanings.sent3: The dumper at the park made the kids giggle as it dropped sand for the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a dumper, unloading all her frustrations at once.
meanings.sent5: The dumper in the storybook was a magical creature that could make anything disappear.

meanings.definition: A vehicle or machine used for dumping.
meanings.sent1: The dumper truck carried rocks to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used the dumper to unload hay for the animals.
meanings.sent3: The dumper beeped loudly as it backed up, warning everyone to move out of the way.
meanings.sent4: The dumper roared to life, ready to clear the debris from the road.
meanings.sent5: The dumper's hydraulic system lifted the heavy load effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The park had separate dumpers for recycling and regular trash.
meanings.sent2: The industrial dumper was overflowing with discarded materials.
meanings.sent3: The dumper by the curb was full of old furniture waiting for pickup.
meanings.sent4: The dumper's lid was closed tightly to prevent any odors from escaping.
meanings.sent5: The dumper's wheels made it easy to move around the waste disposal area.

meanings.definition: A person who ends a romantic relationship abruptly.
meanings.sent1: She was heartbroken when he turned out to be a dumper.
meanings.sent2: The dumper didn't even give her a chance to explain.
meanings.sent3: The dumper's breakup text was so short, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: Being a dumper in a relationship is never a kind choice.
meanings.sent5: The dumper's actions left a trail of broken hearts behind.
